revised_title: Anatomical Abnormalities and Varieties in Human Musculature
tldr: The author examines various cases of anatomical abnormalities and varieties in human musculature, focusing on the unique muscular structure and arrangement in a specific subject. They identify numerous deviations from the ordinary human muscle structure, including the presence of a levator claviculce, a costo-fascialis cervicalis muscle, and a brachio-fascialis. These findings provide insights into the relationship between muscular aberrations in different parts of the body and their potential implications for human physiology.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Anatomy
